sen.j: 正映マキノキネマ（しょうえい-、1932年2月 設立 - 4月 解散）は、かつて京都に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Shoei Makino Kinema (established in February 1932, liquidated in April) was a movie company once existed in Kyoto.
Shoei Makino Kinema (established in February 1932, liquidated in April) was a film company that existed in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: changed "movie" to "film"; eliminated "once"
sen.e: Shoei Makino Kinema (established in February 1932, liquidated in April) was a film company that existed in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 高村正次と立花良介が「マキノ再興」を目指して、かつて牧野省三が建設した「御室撮影所」に設立したが、資金難で2か月で解散した。
sen.e: With the aim of "the revival of Makino", Masatsugu TAKAMURA and Ryosuke TACHIBANA established this company at "Omuro Studio", a studio which was constructed by Shozo MAKINO, but it was liquidated two manths later due to financial difficulty.

Masatsugu TAKAMURA and Ryosuke TACHIBANA established this company aspring for "the revival of Makino" at the "Omuro Studio" constructed by Shozo MAKINO, but it was liquidated in two months due to financial difficulties.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally; chnaged "aim" to "aspire" for "目指"; manths→months
sen.e: Masatsugu TAKAMURA and Ryosuke TACHIBANA established this company aspiring for 'the revival of Makino' at the 'Omuro Studio' constructed by Shozo MAKINO, but it was liquidated in two months due to financial difficulties.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。Aspringをaspiringに変更しました。

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）2月、大衆文芸映画社の高村正次と、半年前まで帝国キネマの専務取締役であった立花良介が、「マキノ本家」と提携し、旧マキノ・プロダクションの「御室撮影所」に設立したのが、この「正映マキノキネマ」である。
sen.e: In February 1932, Masatsugu TAKAMURA of Taishu Bungei Eiga-sha and Ryosuke TACHIBANA, who had been the senior managing director of Teikoku Kinema until half a year before, established "Shoei Makino Kinema" at "Omuro Studio" by tying up with "Makino family".

During February of 1932, Masatsugu TAKAMURA of Taishu Bungei Eiga-sha and Ryosuke TACHIBANA, who had been the senior managing director of Teikoku Kinema half a year prior, established "Shoei Makino Kinema" at "Omuro Studio" by making a joint business with the "Makino family."
sen.cmt: changed "In" to "During"; changed "before" to "prior"; changed "tying up" to "making a joint business"; moved period to inside the quotation marks
sen.e: In February of 1932, Masatsugu TAKAMURA of Taishu Bungei Eiga-sha and Ryosuke TACHIBANA, who had been the senior managing director of Teikoku Kinema half a year prior, established 'Shoei Makino Kinema' at 'Omuro Studio' by making a joint business with the 'Makino family.'
sen.cmt: DuringをInに変更しました。" "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 同撮影所を「正映マキノ撮影所」とし、撮影所長に牧野省三（1929年死去）の妻・知世子が就任した。
sen.e: The studio was named "Shoei Makino Studio" and Chieko, the wife of Shozo MAKINO (died in 19289), became the head of studio.
The studio was named "Shoei Makino Studio" and Shozo MAKINO's wife, Chieko (died in 1929), became the head of the studio.
sen.cmt: changed "Chieko" to be between the commas; 19289→1929
sen.e: The studio was named 'Shoei Makino Studio' and Shozo MAKINO's wife, Chieko (died in 1929), became the head of the studio.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: ところが、原因不明の出火により同撮影所は全焼、焼失する。
sen.e: However, the studio was burnt down by a fire of unknown origin.
The studio was burnt down, however, due to an unknown cause.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: The studio was burnt down, however, due to an unknown cause.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 急造のバラックスタジオで、牧野の長男・マキノ正博監督が『二番手赤穂浪士』ほかを撮影したが、配給網が確立できず、資金難となり、2か月で解散となる。
sen.e: Director Masahiro Makino, the oldest son of Makino, filmed "Nibante Ako Roshi" etc. using hastily-built temporary studio, but the company couldn't secure distribution network and was liquidated two months later due to financial difficulty.

Director Masahiro Makino, Makino's oldest son, filmed "Nabante Ako Roshi" and other films using a hastily built studio, but the company was unable to secure a distribution network and was liquidated two months later due to financial difficulties.
sen.cmt: changed "the oldest son of Makino" to "Makino's oldest son"; changed "etc." to "and other films"; changed "couldn't" to "was unable to"; fixed grammar
sen.e: Director Masahiro Makino, Makino's oldest son, filmed "Nabante Ako Roshi" and other films using a hastily built studio, but the company was unable to secure a distribution network and was liquidated two months later due to financial difficulties.
sen.cmt: NabanteをNibanteに変更しました。

sen.j: 『二番手赤穂浪士』の配給権を日活に売却、代金を従業員への解散手当てとした。
sen.e: The company assigned the distribution right of "Nibante Ako Roshi" to Nikkatsu and used the proceeds from sale for employees' severance allowances.
Distribution rights of "Nibante Ako Roshi" were assigned to Nikkatsu and proceeds from the sales were used to pay employee severence allowances.
sen.cmt: eliminated "The company"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: Distribution rights of "Nibante Ako Roshi" were assigned to Nikkatsu and proceeds from the sales were used to pay employee severance allowances.
sen.cmt: severenceをseveranceに変更しました。

sen.j: また、後藤岱山監督の『仇討兄弟鑑』を大衆文芸映画社との製作提携作とし、「正映マキノキネマ」作品の青山正雄監督の『喧嘩道中記』とともに、菅原通済が当時経営していた洋画配給会社「国際映画社」が配給し、同年5月12日に公開された。
sen.e: Also, it produced "Adauchi Kyodai Kagami" directed by Taizan GOTO jointly with Taishu Bungei Eiga-sha and released it on May 12 of the year, together with "Kenka Dochu-ki", a film produced by "Shoei Makino Kinema" and directed by Masao AOYAMA, through the distribution network of "Kokusai Eiga-sha", a distribution company of western films which was then being managed by Tsusai SUGAWARA.

Shoei Makino Kinema partnered with Taishu Bungei Eiga-sha to produce "Adauchi Kyodai Kagami", directed by Taizan GOTO, and released it on May 12 of the same year together with "Kenka Dochi-ki", produced by "Shoei Makino Kinema" and directed by Masao AOYAMA through the distribution network of "Kokusai Eiga-sha", a western film distribution company managed by Tsusai SUGAWARA.
sen.cmt: eliminated "also"; changed "it" to "Shoei Makino Kinema"; changed "a disribution company of western films" to "a western film distribution company"; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Shoei Makino Kinema partnered with Taishu Bungei Eiga-sha to produce "Adauchi Kyodai Kagami", directed by Taizan GOTO, and released it on May 12 of the same year together with "Kenka Dochi-ki", produced by 'Shoei Makino Kinema' and directed by Masao AOYAMA through the distribution network of 'Kokusai Eiga-sha', a western film distribution company managed by Tsusai SUGAWARA.
sen.cmt: 原文「」の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 製作した映画はすべてサイレント映画であった。
sen.e: All films produced the company were silent films.
All the films that were produced were silent films.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: All the films that were produced were silent films.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: さらに半年後には、高村正次が映画製作を断念した東亜キネマを買収、同社の社長を辞任した南喜三郎とともに、宝塚キネマ興行を御室に設立、「御室撮影所」を「宝塚キネマ撮影所」と改称して稼動させた。
sen.e: Half a year later, Masatsugu TAKAMURA purchased Toa Kinema which had given up film production, established Takarazuka Kinema Kogyo at Omuro jointly with Kisaburo MINAMI who had resigned as the president of Toa, changed "Omuro Studio" to "Takarazuka Kinema Studio" and began its operation.

Half a year later, Masatsugu TAKAMURA took over Toa Kinema that had given up film production, established Takarazuka Kinema Kogyo at Omuro in partnership with Kisaburo MINAMI, who had resigned as the president of Toa, changed "Omuro Studio" to "Takarazuka Kinema Studio" and put it into operation.
sen.cmt: changed "purchased" to "took over" for "買収"; changed "jointly" to "in partnership"; changed "began its operation" to "put it into operation";
sen.e: Half a year later, Masatsugu TAKAMURA took over Toa Kinema that had given up film production, established Takarazuka Kinema Kogyo at Omuro in partnership with Kisaburo MINAMI, who had resigned as the president of Toa, changed 'Omuro Studio' to 'Takarazuka Kinema Studio' and put it into operation.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 「正映マキノキネマ」の残党の受け皿となった。
sen.e: This company took over former employees of "Shoei Makino Kinema".
The new company hired the former employees of "Shoei Makino Kinema".
sen.cmt: added "new"; changed "took over" to "hired";
sen.e: The new company hired the former employees of 'Shoei Makino Kinema.'
